summary: An Ordinance authorizing and directing the City Comptroller to advertise for sale negotiable bonds of The City of Seattle in the sum of Two Hundred Thousand Dollars ($200,000) of bonds in the sum of Four Hundred Thousand Dollars ($400,000) authorized, ratified and voted at the general election held in The City of Seattle on the 8th day of March, 1910, under and pursuant to Ordinance No. 23219 of said city, approved February 1, 1910, and declaring an emergency.
